channel.title: Windows10 on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in Windows10 on Memo Tut

item.title: Environment installation by introducing Docker Image of Kaggle on Windows
item.description: I will record as a reminder the part that was clogged up when I tried to easily build the environment on my windows notebook using Kaggle's Docker Image. Basically, I am referring to the article of “Tenshiki Graffiti”, so please refer to here first, and OS is not Win10 Pro except windows. And if you are using Docker toolbox, I think it will be helpful. Stumble point â‘ Execution of yaml of docker-compose does not work due to error of volume name After creating the docker-compose yaml file as in the above article, I got an error.

item.title: Python environment construction (Anaconda + VSCode) @ Windows10 [January 2020 edition]
item.description: #Background When I made a Python environment with Anaconda + VS Code, I was troubled because the latest setting method did not come out, so I will publish my notes for those who will do it now. It seems that there was a VS Code specification change around 2017. Be careful when reading old commentary. Articles referenced: @Atupon0302: Build Python environment in Windows 10 environment with Anaconda+Visual Studio Code [September 2017]

item.title: Introduce PyTorch (GPU) with Windows10 + Pipenv
item.description: #Introduction While people around me were switching to PyTorch saying that they would like it better, Tensorflow officially made the Tensorboard available, so I decided to change it myself, so I wrote this article. Target audience official pip3 install torch===1.3.1 torchvision===0.4.2 -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html It can be introduced with, but this is for people who want to do it with pipenv install hogehoge So I don’t write about Python or CUDA, so if you are expecting that, please use the browser back!

item.title: Run toio core cube on Windows 10/macOS/Linux with Python library bleak
item.description: # I want to run the toio core cube on a familiar PC The toio core cube is a “very cute” two-wheeled robot that can be controlled by BLE communication. https://toio.github.io/toio-spec/ The other day, I tried to write a story of trying to move the toio core cube directly using BLE communication with a smartphone, but this time using a personal computer I will move the toio core cube.

item.title: python3.8 jupyter notebook in venv environment
item.description: > Information as of 2019 1124. I write so lightly that I die because I am sleepy. 20191227 Addendum This article seems to be in demand Starting confirmation and initial setting. python install I’m using the py launcher, so I cannot pass the path to python. venv environment creation Environment creation. Then activate it. Console is git-bash $ py -m venv hoge $ .hoge/scripts/activate install jupyter under venv environment Update pip and install jupyter.
